intro: Heptapleurum venulosum, commonly known as the veined holly, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and have distinct venation patterns that give it its common name. It thrives in shaded, moist environments and is often found in mountainous regions.
